title.rendered: Stobbs IP and Incopro Join Forces to Help Brands Protect their IP Online

content.rendered:
Stobbs IP will use INCOPRO’s TALISMAN technology and analyst consultancy to strengthen their IP protection services

London – 19 May 2017 – INCOPRO, the online brand protection specialist, has completed a license and collaboration agreement with Stobbs IP. Stobbs IP is licensing INCOPRO’s TALISMAN technology, to provide brands with insight into the scope of online infringements against its brands.

By employing INCOPRO’s TALISMAN platform, Stobbs IP will on behalf of its clients be able to continuously monitor websites, social media, marketplaces and apps for IP infringements and analyse the data in real time to determine where action needs to be taken. Stobbs IP will also be able to track the online activity of commercial counterfeiters, who often promote goods on social media and sell through multiple marketplace-style platforms and websites. INCOPRO’s technology tracks and connects networks of offenders to enable the comprehensive takedown of all associated operations. Through a combination of cutting edge technology and use of its own as well as INCOPRO’s multilingual legal and enforcement experts, Stobbs IP’s clients will benefit from INCOPRO’s connected and actionable insights into IP infringements online.

Julius Stobbs, Principal at Stobbs IP, says: “We’re really excited to be employing INCOPRO’s TALISMAN technology to enhance our existing IP protection services. In recent years, we have seen rising demand for advanced solutions to tackle online IP infringements, and INCOPRO’s unique TALISMAN software was the obvious answer for us. We’re certain that this technology will allow us to provide a more complete solution to IP protection for our clients.”

Simon Baggs, CEO at INCOPRO, says: “We are thrilled to be working with Stobbs IP, which we believe is one of the most innovative IP law firms in the UK. This agreement presents both parties with new and exciting opportunities, but ultimately it will enable more brands to understand the landscape of the online infringements they face and to be able to act against counterfeiters.”

– ENDS –

About INCOPRO
Founded in 2012, INCOPRO is an online IP and brand protection company. Its proprietary technology platform TALISMAN collates a mass of data on brand infringement and automatically identifies and prioritises IP violations. Its clustering technology is uniquely able to track and connect the commercial scale counterfeiters, enabling comprehensive takedown of all associated operations.

Headquartered in London, with INCOPRO’s analysts working across the United States, Europe, and Asia, INCOPRO works with some of the largest global brands to provide connected and actionable insights into IP infringements online. For additional information regarding INCOPRO, please visit www.incoproip.com.

About Stobbs IP
Stobbs IP is an innovative IP law firm handling all aspects of brand protection and advisory work from clearance and protection to enforcement, licensing and policy. It has a unique practical virtual in house approach. Founded by Julius Stobbs 4 years ago, it was awarded the MIP trade mark firm of the year in 2016 and is already in the top tier for trade marks in the Legal500, MIP and WTR reviews. For more information regarding Stobbs, please visit www.stobbsip.com.

To find out more how INCOPRO can help your brand protect itself in the ever challenging online environment, please contact us.
